description.value:
This extension asserts that the data in a resource was authored (collected/handled/created/transformed) by an application that claims conformance to the definition of a feature.
For further information about features, see the [Application Features Implementation Guide](https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/capstmt/specification.html).
This extension is a statement about the provenance of a particular version of the resource that it is describing; as such, it should be made in a Provenance resource referring to that particular version. Alternatively, the extension can be placed in the resource about which the assertion is made (in Resource.meta); in this case, the assertion SHOULD be removed when the resource data is altered (it may be replaced by a new assertion).
This assertion is often used to drive processing rules associated with the trustworthiness of the data in the resource. Applications/specifications/workflows that make use of this assertion should carefully consider the integrity of the chain of handling from the source the processing before choosing to trust the assertion.
A more complex alternative to this profile is to use the [[[http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/obligations-profile]]] extension.

short.value: Authored by an application conforming to a set of obligations

definition.value: A declaration that the data in a resource was authored by an application that conformed to the set of element level obligations described in the referenced profile
